subject: Climate & Environment
title: The Trillion Tree Debate
description: A 60-second lesson on The Trillion Tree Debate.

hook.text: A 2019 study said planting a trillion trees could capture two-thirds of human emissions.

buildup.text: The idea went viral. Governments and corporations pledged billions of trees.

discovery.text: Critics quickly pointed out the math was flawed â€” the real capture is much lower.

twist.text: Planting trees on grasslands and savannas can actually harm those ecosystems.

climax.text: Planting the right trees in the right places helps. Planting anywhere just for numbers hurts.

punchline.text: A trillion trees is a slogan. Where they go is what matters.

quiz.question: Why did scientists criticize the trillion-tree campaign?
options: The carbon capture math was overestimated
Trees were too expensive to plant
